DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine feasibility acceptability efficacy two month technology-based weight loss program overweight obese college student .
DOC.brief_title: A Technology-Based Intervention Reduction Overweight Obesity Among College Students
DOC.detailed_description: A randomize control trial design employ investigate effectiveness , feasibility , acceptability technology-based weight loss pilot intervention reduction overweight obesity college student . Participants randomly assign one two condition : ( 1 ) 8-week intervention group , ( 2 ) 8-week attention control group . Both condition include 8 weekly lesson 8 week . Undergraduate student ( n=100 ) age 18-22 year overweight obese ( BMI ≥ 25 kg/m2 ) recruit University Tennessee Knoxville . Measurements take baseline 8 week . Since study technology-based intervention , research staff collect height weight measure BMI novel approach , utilize Skype video conferencing .
DOC.criteria: Eligibility include UTK undergraduate student overweight obese ( BMI ≥ 25 kg/m2 ) 1822 year age , access Internet , personal computer ( laptop , tablet , desktop computer ) , smartphone . Any individual meet inclusion criterion exclude participation study . Students medical condition precludes adherence dietary recommendation Who currently prescribe medication may impact weight , currently participate plan participate another weight loss program next six month Who diagnose major psychiatric illness ( e.g. , bipolar disorder , schizophrenia , depression ) within last 12 month Who pregnant plan become pregnant next six month Who give birth within last six month Who diagnose type eat disorder within past 12 month ineligible .
